alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 11 at 4:01PM EST until March 13 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT MONDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 11 feet in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Oceanside areas from Cape Hatteras north. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 8 AM EDT Monday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor oceanside flooding and localized minor ocean overwash possible late tonight into Monday morning due to wave run up from low pressure offshore. Up to 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront may experience shallow flooding. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion are also possible. The areas most vulnerable will be oceanside locations north of Cape Hatteras where dune structures are vulnerable, mainly around times of high tide. High tide is around 10 PM tonight.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
